div.head: For torture (God-forbid)
div.ab: When one is on the way to the prison, he must say three times, a michtam of David, protect me God, for I seek refuge in you, and then when he comes into the prison, he must immediately(?) urinate in his right hand, and must drink the urine, three times, and when he has drunk it three times, he must wash (wipe?) his hands on the wall or on the ground (lit. ground wall). [If there is] water in the prison, that is even better; so must he wash his hands already, when they call him so that he must go out of the prison because they want to interrogate him, so must he say three times, Because he is devoted to me, I will deliver him, I will keep him safe, for he knows my name. When they make him remove his clothes, he must say three times: Viksos Vaksos, Tribon Triban, Vaksos Viksos. And he must say this three times as well: God, do not abandon me like Uriel, Uziel, and Gabriel.
